title: Drawing, "Botanical Studies with Flying Parrots, Boquia, Colombia", July 1853
markings:
Watermark:  [JOH] ANNOT
Recto:  Stamped in ink, at lower left: Lugt 457c
Verso:  Stamped in ink, at lower center: Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper center:  Parrots; again, at center left:  2 - dead leaves of a / Brownish straw color / 3 Large bunches / of brilliant / scarlet berries / Coroso; again, at left center:  This tree / grows in many / beautiful forms / often resembling / the Elm, with a / multiplicity of / branches which / are more ir-regular / than the Elm I - / Branches at top / vandyke brown; again, at center right:  Dark green main / rib of leaf light green / - bush -; again, at lower left:  2 whitish grey green very / distinct from the mass of / green  - in clustered / masses; again, at lower center:  2 dead / About 15 ft / high leaves very / large; again, at lower right:  The same / Under side / of leaf very strongly / ribbed in - relief;  and again, at bottom right:  Boquia N. Granada / July - I 53
description: Horizontal sheet  with tree flying parrots at the top, followed by two rows with each  containing three botanical sketches.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Botanical Studies with Flying Parrots, Boquia, Colombia", July 1853.
July 1853. Graphite on tan-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-878.
